title: The inquest reveals Wilson's suspicions, but Catherine lies to protect her sister. Michaelis's testimony brings Wilson's suspicions to light, but Catherine denies any connection between her sister and Gatsby, claiming her sister was happy with her husband. She convinces herself of her statements and cries, leading to Wilson being labeled as 'deranged by grief'

pool. Someone with a positive manner, perhaps a detective, used the
expression “madman” as he bent over Wilson’s body that afternoon, and
the adventitious authority of his voice set the key for the newspaper
reports next morning.

Most of those reports were a nightmare—grotesque, circumstantial,
